info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 5:12PM EDT until July 12 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of east central and eastern New York, including the following counties, Warren and Hamilton.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indian Lake, North Creek, Sabael, Christian Hill, North River and Holcombville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING
